Description: Hemispherical bowl with flat lid. Decoration consists of roundels and friezes of foliate ornament. Made of raised brass, engraved and inlaid (metal inlay now missing, black substance remains).
Curator's comments: On the origin of this type of metalware: D. Behrens-Abouseif, "Veneto-Saracenic Metalware, a Mamluk Art", Mamluk Studies Review 9 (2005) 147-172.
Bibliographic references: La Niece, Ward et al 1995 / Veneto-Saracenic metalwork: an analysis of the bowls and incense burners in the British Museum
